title: 2019–20 Club Atlético Lanús season
text:
The 2019–20 season is <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Lan%C3%BAs">Lanús</a>' 29th consecutive season in the top division of Argentine <a href="Association%20football">football</a>. In addition to the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Primera División</a>, the club are competing in the <a href="2018%E2%80%9319%20Copa%20Argentina">Copa Argentina</a>, <a href="2020%20Copa%20de%20la%20Superliga">Copa de la Superliga</a> and <a href="2020%20Copa%20Sudamericana">Copa Sudamericana</a>.
The season generally covers the period from 1 July 2019 to 30 June 2020.
Review.
Pre-season.
Young right winger Matías Vera was Lanús' first departure, as he agreed to be loaned to <a href="Barracas%20Central">Barracas Central</a> on 7 June 2019; <a href="Leandro%20Maciel">Leandro Maciel</a> also left on loan, joining <a href="Aldosivi">Aldosivi</a> five days later. Barracas Central signed another player from Lanús, with forward <a href="Rodrigo%20Pacheco%20%28footballer%29">Rodrigo Pacheco</a> agreeing permanent terms with the newly-promoted <a href="Primera%20B%20Nacional">Primera B Nacional</a> team on 11 June. On the same day, the club announced their first incoming - <a href="Ezequiel%20Mu%C3%B1oz">Ezequiel Muñoz</a> from <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a>'s <a href="CD%20Legan%C3%A9s">Leganés</a>. <a href="Agust%C3%ADn%20Rossi%20%28footballer%29">Agustín Rossi</a> joined the club on loan from <a href="Boca%20Juniors">Boca Juniors</a> on 12 June. A third transaction with Barracas Central was confirmed on 21 June, with <a href="Marcos%20Pinto">Marcos Pinto</a> agreeing to join them on loan from 3 July. Further players departed Lanús on loan on 22 June, as <a href="Marcos%20Astina">Marcos Astina</a> and <a href="Leonardo%20Flores%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201997%29">Leonardo Flores</a> penned contracts with <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Atlanta">Atlanta</a>.
<a href="Luciano%20Abecasis">Luciano Abecasis</a> completed a move from <a href="Godoy%20Cruz%20Antonio%20Tomba">Godoy Cruz</a> on 26 June. <a href="Mat%C3%ADas%20Ib%C3%A1%C3%B1ez">Matías Ibáñez</a> was loaned to <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Patronato">Patronato</a> on 29 June. Numerous loans from the previous campaign officially expired on and around 30 June. They were due to meet <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%203%20de%20Febrero">3 de Febrero</a> in a pre-season friendly on that same day, but the match was cancelled a day prior. <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20de%20Rafaela">Atlético de Rafaela</a> snapped up <a href="J%C3%BAnior%20Mendieta">Júnior Mendieta</a> and <a href="Alan%20Bonansea">Alan Bonansea</a> from Lanús on 3 July. <a href="Barracas%20Central">Barracas Central</a> formalised a fourth signing from the club, a third on loan, on 4 July as <a href="Enzo%20Ortiz">Enzo Ortiz</a> headed off across <a href="Buenos%20Aires">Buenos Aires</a>. <a href="Gabriel%20Ram%C3%ADrez%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201995%29">Gabriel Ramírez</a> moved to <a href="Quilmes%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Club">Quilmes</a> on 5 July. Lanús and <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Nacional">Atlético Nacional</a> played out a goalless exhibition draw on 6 July, in front of 18,122 fans. <a href="Sergio%20Fabi%C3%A1n%20Gonz%C3%A1lez">Sergio González</a> went to <a href="Independiente%20Rivadavia">Independiente Rivadavia</a> on 8 July.
<a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Sand">José Sand</a> and <a href="Pablo%20Mart%C3%ADnez%20%28Paraguayan%20footballer%29">Pablo Martínez</a> scored goals in separate friendlies with <a href="Club%20de%20Gimnasia%20y%20Esgrima%20La%20Plata">Gimnasia y Esgrima</a> on 10 July as the club secured back-to-back wins. <a href="Fernando%20Barrientos">Fernando Barrientos</a> was loaned to <a href="Club%20Guaran%C3%AD">Guaraní</a> on 10 July, as <a href="Sebasti%C3%A1n%20Ribas">Sebastián Ribas</a> also left on loan on 11 July to <a href="Rosario%20Central">Rosario Central</a>. <a href="Nicol%C3%A1s%20Orsini">Nicolás Orsini</a> was transferred to Lanús from <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Sarmiento">Sarmiento</a> on 12 July. <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Patronato">Patronato</a> got the better of Lanús across two exhibition matches on 13 July. On 14 July, <a href="Facundo%20Monteseirin">Facundo Monteseirin</a> switched Lanús for <a href="San%20Mart%C3%ADn%20de%20San%20Juan">San Martín</a>. A second loan incoming came on 17 July in <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20River%20Plate">River Plate</a>'s <a href="Carlos%20Auzqui">Carlos Auzqui</a>. Also on that date, they shared victories in friendly matches with <a href="Arsenal%20de%20Sarand%C3%AD">Arsenal de Sarandí</a>.
July.
An injury time strike from <a href="Marcelino%20Moreno">Marcelino Moreno</a> saw Lanús progress through the <a href="Copa%20Argentina">Copa Argentina</a> round of thirty-two on 20 July, as they eliminated Independiente Rivadavia of Primera B Nacional. <a href="Guillermo%20Acosta">Guillermo Acosta</a>, days after featuring in the Copa Argentina match, headed to <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Tucum%C3%A1n">Atlético Tucumán</a> on 25 July; seven months after Lanús had signed him from Tucumán. Lanús and Gimnasia y Esgrima shared the points on day one of the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">2019–20 Primera División</a>, with <a href="Lautaro%20Valenti">Lautaro Valenti</a> netting on his league bow for "Granate". <a href="Jorge%20Valdez%20Chamorro">Jorge Valdez Chamorro</a> went to Atlanta on 31 July.
August.
Lanús conceded three goals in a fixture away to <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20River%20Plate">River Plate</a> in the league on 4 August. <a href="Nahuel%20Tecilla">Nahuel Tecilla</a>, to join former teammates Valdez Chamorro, Astina and Flores, signed for Atlanta on 7 August. Lanús put four past <a href="Barracas%20Central">Barracas Central</a> across two friendly games on 9 August. On 18 August, Lanús defeated <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20V%C3%A9lez%20Sarsfield">Vélez Sarsfield</a> 3–1 for their first <a href="Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Primera División</a> win of the season. Lanús drew 1–1 with <a href="Defensores%20de%20Belgrano">Defensores de Belgrano</a> in a mid-season friendly on 21 August. Lanús made it six points from a possible six across their last two matches on 25 August, after <a href="Carlos%20Auzqui">Carlos Auzqui</a> and <a href="Lautaro%20Acosta">Lautaro Acosta</a> scored to give them victory over <a href="Uni%C3%B3n%20de%20Santa%20Fe">Unión Santa Fe</a>. On 30 August, Lanús won their third consecutive league match after beating <a href="Central%20C%C3%B3rdoba%20de%20Santiago%20del%20Estero">Central Córdoba</a> at home.
September.
An exhibition game with <a href="Club%20Almagro">Almagro</a> opened September for Lanús, as a brace from <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Luis%20Sinisterra">José Luis Sinisterra</a> was followed by a goal from <a href="Gast%C3%B3n%20Lodico">Gastón Lodico</a> as they achieved a 3–1 win on 3 September.
Transfers.
"Domestic transfer windows:3 July 2019 to 24 September 201920 January 2020 to 19 February 2020."
Friendlies.
Pre-season.
Lanús agreed a pre-season friendly with <a href="Atl%C3%A9tico%20Nacional">Atlético Nacional</a> in early June, with the fixture announced to take place at the <a href="Atanasio%20Girardot%20Sports%20Complex%23Atanasio%20Girardot%20Stadium">Estadio Atanasio Girardot</a> in <a href="Medell%C3%ADn">Medellín</a>, Colombia on 4 July 2019. Later friendlies were subsequently set with <a href="Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Argentine Primera División</a> trio <a href="Club%20de%20Gimnasia%20y%20Esgrima%20La%20Plata">Gimnasia y Esgrima</a>, <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Patronato">Patronato</a> and <a href="Arsenal%20de%20Sarand%C3%AD">Arsenal de Sarandí</a>. Lanús revealed a friendly with <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%203%20de%20Febrero">3 de Febrero</a> for 30 June, with the match taking place in <a href="Ciudad%20del%20Este">Ciudad del Este</a>; where they were having a training camp. However, the meeting was cancelled on 29 June.
Mid-season.
Lanús and <a href="Barracas%20Central">Barracas Central</a> would meet in a friendly on 9 August in <a href="Ezeiza%2C%20Buenos%20Aires">Ezeiza</a>. <a href="Defensores%20de%20Belgrano">Defensores de Belgrano</a> would visit Lanús on 21 August, with <a href="Club%20Almagro">Almagro</a> doing the same on 3 September.
Competitions.
Primera División.
Relegation table.
Source: <a href="https%3A//info.afa.org.ar/deposito/html/v3/index.html%3Fchannel%3Ddeportes.futbol.primeraa.descenso%26amp%3Blang%3Des_LA">AFA</a>
Matches.
The fixtures for the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Argentine%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">2019–20</a> campaign were released on 10 July.
Copa Argentina.
Lanús versus <a href="Independiente%20Rivadavia">Independiente Rivadavia</a>, in the <a href="Copa%20Argentina">Copa Argentina</a> R32, was scheduled for the <a href="Estadio%20Julio%20Humberto%20Grondona">Estadio Julio Humberto Grondona</a>, a neutral stadium as is normal in the cup, in <a href="Avellaneda">Avellaneda</a> on 20 July 2019. After defeating the <a href="Primera%20B%20Nacional">Primera B Nacional</a> team, Lanús were drawn to face <a href="Argentinos%20Juniors">Argentinos Juniors</a> in the round of sixteen.
Squad statistics.
Appearances and goals.
"Statistics accurate as of 31 August 2019."
